"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551dd1f86368723a06d81000#post_551dd1f86368723a06d81000
The One-Punch man anime. (1: It's from a teaser for a show that's coming out in october, 2: It's supposed to be a FOTNS/One Piece type rapid punching thing.)
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551dd2686368723a063f1100#post_551dd2686368723a063f1100
Don't take this the wrong way, *BUT* if the teaser trailer has that bad of animation, when it's your fucking teaser and what you put as your first foot forward to the public to show them why they should watch your anime, then chances are the animation in the actual show is going to be very disappointing.  If there's already animation derps showing up then you're probably going to be disappointed with the animation quality when it finally airs.

Why?  Cause that sort of animation error in the trailer shows that the anime is going to be extremely low budget.

the off topic i used to frequent never had a prevalent topic, at least not in its prime
topics.author: 50a843d47f123b2e7c001359

topics.body:
"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551ddbd56368721951810b00#post_551ddbd56368721951810b00
Eh; we just talk about anime cause we're so different in tastes that we can't agree on literally anything.



I could constantly talk people's ears off about science, but nobody cares.  I talked earlier that potentially we may have found evidence for alien life but nobody cared.

If we talk about the morality of scientific advancement nobody can agree on it either; the only thing any of us can agree on the topic of morality towards scientific advancement is that how we're looking at mass manufactured humans is going too far.

I occasionally talk about politics but far too many people have the mentality of "my party will win because it's my party and therefore they will win because it's my party and therefore it will will win".



At least we don't discuss religion anymore; back before the religion thread was made it was constant yelling of people going essentially "fuck you!  My religion is right!"
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551ddbd56368721951810b00#post_551ddbd56368721951810b00
It's one of the most popular internet topics in general anyways

Also equally amusing is the fact that the many attempts to direct the anime discussion to a separate thread have also ended with the thread fading into obscurity

If it succeeded, this thread would honestly lose most of its purpose :P
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200

topics.body:
Here's a topic then:
*IF* that radio wave does turn out to be aliens for real how would you react to it?

The book is still out and they're going to have to determine if the signal is from a pulsar, but if it does turn out to be aliens how would you react?


Before you ask what is the probability of it actually being aliens we don't know because as far as we don't know pulsars don't behave that way so either it's aliens or it's a ground breaking discovery in physics on par with the discovery of gravity that completely changes our understanding of reality.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

"@AppleJackFrost":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551de03a636872520c9f0700#post_551de03a636872520c9f0700
[bq="AppleJackFrost"]Morning pones, what's happening?[/bq]
Tl:dr of something *EVERYONE* in the thread keeps ignoring for some unknown reason; we may have found evidence of intelligent aliens.

They're seeing if the signal is from a pulsar but if it's not from a pulsar then we have definitively found evidence that intelligent aliens are real.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/551ddff2636872520c4f0700#post_551ddff2636872520c4f0700
[bq="uc9"]Here's a topic then:
*IF* that radio wave does turn out to be aliens for real how would you react to it?[/bq]
i wouldnt care because i'd assume that it has nothing to do with my immediate future

the problem with scientific/philosophical posts is that they're either much too shallow to continue a discussion (like mine) or they're well thought out replies that take more than a casual usage of the mind, which is pretty self explanatory as to why those posts are rare

honestly i'd just prefer casual conversation, but when it's about hakibakisake fighting cheechachow ive got no idea of how to build on that and keep the discussion going. i'd bet that twisty and tokishishi feel the same as theyve stated that they didnt really feel like they belonged here
